list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’m rarely ill – I’m really a very healthy person
My bank balance is healthier now than it used to be.

list_definition.definition: causing or helping to produce good health
showing a sensible concern for one’s own well-being etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He shows a healthy respect for the law.

list_ex_of_english: The retirees were more likely than the pre-retired husbands to perceive their wives as healthier than themselves.
Though we may perhaps feel that a healthier, non-dominated existence must be better for her, she need not concur in that judgment given her current evaluative perspective.
Just as with organically grown food, only certain people will pay extra for what they consider to be healthier, more natural foods.
Men with a severe illness selected physical health less often than healthier men.
People under stress who have a greater sense of control, commitment and challenge will stay healthier than people who are less hardy.
Consciousness of one's own irrational urges was healthier than denial.
Many thought price premiums are also justified because they perceived organic products to be healthier, more nutritious and more delicious.
In most studies, employed women have been found to be physically and psychologically healthier than nonemployed women.
